text: The reference from the cover page with Law is based on a famous story about Ikkyu-san, a Zen Buddhist monk in the 14-15th century. His mischievous childhood exploits, outwitting adults during his stay at Anokoku-ji temple, have been retold countless times in folklore.

Toei animation produced a hit anime series based on these legends between 1975 and 1982. This show popularized the image of Ikkyu-san planning while in lotus position with his index fingers on his head.

One of the most famous tales involves a lord trying to test the boy by claiming he needed help taming a tiger that would sneak out of a byobu folding screen. This lie fails as Ikkyu-san is able to make the lord admit it is impossible for the tiger to get out of the painting.
Law was probably chosen for this request because he is known for his planning and his nickname トラ = "tora" is Japanese for tiger.
